column4: its as simple as fdisk not wanting to write what I tell it to write
if I format the drive completely and re-install ubuntu it'd be fine but I don't feel like making that much work considering I need to also format my desktop system today
Is Intrepid fairly stable?
for a RC?
if hardy works, dont fix it
have you checked its health?
health of a partition that I'm trying to format?
id get the tool from the manufacturers sitre and check it
what the heck are you talking about?
if it isn't broken but I'm bored I fix it, plus the fact that fdisk can't make any changes to my HDD is annoying me so I'm gonna probably end up having to format
rar runs fine here, mind you i havent used file > 20Mb
RAR is propriatary and has worse preformance under linux/unix than its WinRAR counterpart
grab the minimal CD and boot from that
you can't put a cd into a drive when the machine is over 10000km away
you can, with drac ;)
i do it every day
yes drac provides a virtual floppy and cd drive
you of course need a drac card and a drac compatible server but it is possible
configure a pxe server and boot from it
what now? lol
if you configure a pxe server you can make the server boot from that
and if something screws up when it trys to boot into that PXE server, then I have no way of getting the server to boot back into the current distro
could be hard but may be possibe. I know of a distro that has a public pxe server and an ISO you can boot to to kick it off, just cant remember the name
